TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UnmanagedMemoryStream extends System.IO.Stream

summary.span: 提供从托管代码访问非托管内存块的能力。

span.span: Provides access to unmanaged blocks of memory from managed code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类支持对非托管内存使用现有的基于流的模型的访问，并且不需要的非托管内存中的内容复制到堆。This class supports access to unmanaged memory using the existing stream-based model and does not require that the contents in the unmanaged memory be copied to the heap. [!INCLUDE[note_unnecessary_dispose](~/includes/note-unnecessary-dispose.md)] ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块是分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

summary.span: 使用指定的位置、内存长度、内存总量和文件访问值初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified location, memory length, total amount of memory, and file access values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `length`参数定义中使用的当前内存量。The `length` parameter defines the current amount of memory in use. 如果读取或追加到流中，数据`length`值应该等于从读取的流中的有效数据量或保留。If reading or appending data to the stream, the `length` value should be equal to the amount of valid data in the stream to be read from or preserved. 写入流，则此值应为零。If writing to the stream, this value should be zero. `capacity`参数指示可用的总内存量。The `capacity` parameter indicates the amount of total memory available. 此值可以描述的长度超过指定的长度的区域，或指示可以追加到的区域。This value can describe a region that is longer than the length specified, or indicate a region that can be appended to. 任何尝试写入超出此值将失败。Any attempt to write beyond this value will fail. `access`参数集，和属性。The `access` parameter sets the , and properties. 请注意该指定不保证的流将是可写。Note that specifying does not guarantee that the stream will be writable. 访问参数允许实施者创建其实现可以匹配实际流公开的对象。The access parameters allow the implementer to create an object whose implementation can match the actual stream that is exposed. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块是分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示流是否支持读取。

value.span: 如果对象是用一个构造函数创建的，而该构造函数的 参数不包括读取流，或者如果流已关闭，则为 ，否则为 。

span.span: if the object was created by a constructor with an parameter that did not include reading the stream and if the stream is closed; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性指示当前的流对象是否支持读取。This property indicates whether the current stream object supports reading. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块是分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. 在此示例中，对象传递给检查的方法然后再尝试向控制台显示内容的属性。In this example, an object is passed to a method which checks the property before attempting to display the contents to the console. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream_Example#00](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream_Example/cs/program.cs#00)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性指示当前的流对象是否支持写入。This property indicates whether the current stream object supports writing. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块是分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. 在此示例中，对象传递给检查的方法尝试将数据写入流之前的属性。In this example, an object is passed to a method which checks the property before attempting to write the data to the stream. .property instance int64 Capacity
Public ReadOnly Property Capacity As Long
public: property long Capacity { long get(); };

summary.span: 获取流的长度（大小）或分配给流的内存总量（容量）。

span.span: Gets the stream length (size) or the total amount of memory assigned to a stream (capacity).
The size or capacity of the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回`capacity`为构造函数提供的值。This property returns the `capacity` value provided to the constructor. 如果没有`capacity`初始化流时指定的值，则此属性返回的流长度。If no `capacity` value was specified when the stream was initialized, this property returns the stream length.

span.span: The stream is closed.

param.name: disposing
param.span: 若要释放托管资源和非托管资源，则为 ；若仅释放非托管资源，则为 。

span.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: 释放由 占用的非托管资源，还可以另外再释放托管资源。

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法称为由公共方法和方法。This method is called by the public method and the method. 调用受保护方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 方法。This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 在重写请注意不要引用已释放的以前调用中的对象。

span.span: When overriding be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 有关详细信息和，请参阅[清洗向上非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

summary.span: 重写 方法以便不执行任何操作。

span.span: Overrides the method so that no action is performed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法不执行任何操作且此类不作为的一部分包括基类。This method performs no action for this class but is included as part of the base class. 由于任何数据写入 RAM，此方法是冗余的。Since any data is written to RAM, this method is redundant.

span.span: The stream is closed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法相当于构造函数。This method is equivalent to the constructor. 它支持需要初始化之前设置流变量的指针，因此，不能调用参数化构造函数的方法。It supports methods that need to initialize the pointer before setting stream variables and, therefore, cannot call the parameterized constructor. 此类方法应使用默认构造函数，初始化指针，，然后调用方法。Such methods should use the default constructor, , initialize the pointer, and then invoke the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果流已初始化，因为保持不变，此属性将返回提供给构造函数的长度值。If unchanged since the stream was initialized, this property returns the length value provided to the constructor. 如果发生了更改写入流，此属性将反映对数据的长度的任何更改。If changes to the stream have occurred, this property reflects any changes to the length of the data. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块是分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. .property instance int64 Position
Public Overrides Property Position As Long
public: virtual property long Position { long get(); void set(long value); };

summary.span: 获取或设置流中的当前位置。

span.span: Gets or sets the current position in a stream.
The current position in the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 初始化流时，此属性设置为零。When a stream is initialized, this property is set to zero. 虽然你可以设置流的容量超出流的当前位置，你将无法访问该区域使用和方法。Although you can set the position of the stream beyond the stream's capacity, you will not be able to access that area using the and methods. 将返回 0 和将引发。 will return 0 and will throw a . 此支持是主要用于与基本的流操作的设计和代码兼容性。This support is primarily for design and code compatibility with basic stream operations.

span.span: The stream is closed.

exception.span: 位置被设置为小于 0 的值，或者位置大于 或在添加到当前指针时导致溢出。

span.span: The position is set to a value that is less than zero, or the position is larger than or results in overflow when added to the current pointer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要将指针返回到整个流，将设置以零，然后调用此属性的属性。To return a pointer to the entire stream, set the property to zero, and then call this property.

exception.span: 当前位置大于流的容量。

span.span: The current position is larger than the capacity of the stream.

exception.span: 所设置的位置不是当前流中的有效位置。

span.span: The position is being set is not a valid position in the current stream.

exception.span: 指针被设置为比流的开始位置小的值。

span.span: The pointer is being set to a lower value than the starting position of the stream.
The stream was initialized for use with a .

span.span: The property is valid only for streams that are initialized with a pointer.

span.span: for calling unmanaged code, such as calling native code with platform invoke or COM integration.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read([out] unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Read (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer) As Integer
public: override int Read(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offset, int count);

param.name: buffer
param.span: 此方法返回时，该缓冲区包含指定的字节数组，该数组的 offset 和 (offset + count - 1) 之间的值由从当前源中读取的字节替换。

span.span: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

param.span: 此参数未经初始化即被传递。

span.span: This parameter is passed uninitialized.

param.name: offset
param.span: buffer 中从零开始的字节偏移量，从此处开始存储从当前流中读取的数据。

span.span: The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.

param.name: count
param.span: 要从当前流中读取的最大字节数。

span.span: The maximum number of bytes to read from the current stream.

summary.span: 将指定数量的字节读入指定的数组。

span.span: Reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.

returns.span: 读入缓冲区中的总字节数。

span.span: The total number of bytes read into the buffer.

returns.span: 如果很多字节当前不可用，则总字节数可能小于请求的字节数；如果已到达流结尾，则为零 (0)。

span.span: This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `offset`参数指定了中的字节的偏移量`array`从此处开始读取，参数 （缓冲区索引） 和`count`参数指定了最大要从此流中读取的字节数。The `offset` parameter gives the offset of the byte in the `array` parameter (the buffer index) at which to begin reading, and the `count` parameter gives the maximum number of bytes to be read from this stream. 如果已到达流结尾，则返回的值是实际数字节，则为零。The returned value is the actual number of bytes read, or zero if the end of the stream is reached. 如果读取的操作成功，是通过读取的字节数高级流的当前位置。If the read operation is successful, the current position of the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read. 如果发生异常，则流的当前位置不变。If an exception occurs, the current position of the stream is unchanged. 方法返回仅在到达流的末尾后的零。The method returns zero only after reaching the end of the stream. 否则为始终至少 1 个字节从流中读取在返回之前。Otherwise, always reads at least one byte from the stream before returning. 如果不会提供数据时调用流中，该方法将一直阻止到至少一个字节的数据可以返回。If no data is available from the stream upon a call to , the method will block until at least one byte of data can be returned. 实现可以自由地返回少于所请求的字节，即使尚未达到流结尾。An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块是分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream/cs/sample.cs#1)]

span.span: Asynchronously reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.

summary.span: 可以开始于 [!INCLUDE[net_2015](~/includes/net-2015-md.md)]

span.span: Available starting in [!INCLUDE[net_2015](~/includes/net-2015-md.md)]

returns.span: 表示异步读取操作的任务。

returns.span: 如果当前可用字节数少于所请求的字节数，则该结果值可小于所请求的字节数；如果已到达流结尾时，则为 0（零）。

span.span: The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果读取操作过程中发生异常，它将设置为返回的任务的属性。If an exception occurs during the read operation, it will be set as the of the property of the returned task.

Public Overrides Function ReadByte () As Integer
public: override int ReadByte();

summary.span: 从流中读取一个字节，并将流内的位置前移一个字节，或者如果已到达流的末尾，则返回 -1。

span.span: Reads a byte from a stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.

returns.span: 转换为 对象的无符号字节，或者如果到达流的末尾，则为 -1。

span.span: The unsigned byte cast to an object, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法从流中返回整数值。Use this method to return integer values from the stream. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入到非托管的内存使用类。The following code example demonstrates how to read from and write to unmanaged memory using the class. 非托管内存块是分配和解除分配使用类。A block of unmanaged memory is allocated and de-allocated using the class. 在此示例中，对象传递给检查的方法之前正在尝试读取并向控制台显示内容的属性。In this example, an object is passed to a method which checks the property before attempting to read and display the contents to the console. [!code-csharp[System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream_Example#00](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream_Example/cs/program.cs#00)]

param.name: value
param.span: 流的长度。

span.span: The length of the stream.

summary.span: 将流的长度设置为指定的值。

span.span: Sets the length of a stream to a specified value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果给定的值小于当前流的长度，则流将被截断。If the given value is less than the current length of the stream, the stream is truncated. 如果给定的值大于当前流的长度，则流被扩展。If the given value is larger than the current length of the stream, the stream is expanded. 如果流已展开，旧和新的长度之间流的内容是不确定的。If the stream is expanded, the contents of the stream between the old and the new lengths are undefined. 流必须支持写入和查找有关工作。A stream must support both writing and seeking for to work.
